Much has been written about transhumanism
over the past twenty years, such that it is difficult to add anything new to the debate. present paper does not presume to be novel
in this regard. Instead, its main purpose is to
draw out the philosophical foundations of the
transhumanist project, setting forth its roots
in philosophical positivism and its confidence
in the liberating power of technology, and to
consider the implications for anthropology,
the determination of human purpose, and
object of human hope. In this regard, it may
provide a platform to critique other contemporary prospects of “enhancement” that share
transhumanist tendencies, such as artificial
intelligence and Neuralink, gender fluidity,

hope, characterized by an absolute belief in

confidence in the powers of technology, the
transhumanist cause is projected as the “new

origins, such optimistic aspirations are rooted
in negativity and frustration over humanity’s
